title: How to Make Apple Pie Turnovers

steps.headline: Combine the flour, butter, water, and salt.
steps.description: Be sure to melt the butter! Add all these ingredients into a big bowl and use a rubber spatula to make your crust.

steps.headline: Core, peel, and dice the apples.
steps.description: Core them, then cut the skin with a butcher knife, and dice them into small, bite-size pieces.

steps.headline: Caramelize and season the apples.
steps.description: Heat a pan on medium-low, and melt 2 tablespoons of butter in the pan. When the butter is melted add all the apples. Let them sit for around 5 minutes, or until they're soft enough to poke a fork through with ease. Put in the brown sugar, stir, and let them sit until the juices thicken (Around 3 minutes). Remove all heat and add the cinnamon.

steps.headline: Cut the dough.
steps.description: Use any size cutter to your preference, but I usually use a cutter the size of my hands put together as a circle.

steps.headline: Add the apples, fold, seal, and vent.
steps.description: Depending on the size of your pie, add apples to the middle. After they're added, fold over the dough. Seal the sides with a fork, and get a toothpick and add three, rice-size vent holes.

steps.headline: Glaze.
steps.description: Combine the sugar, egg, and water in a bowl, and glaze each pie.

steps.headline: Bake.
steps.description: Bake each pie at 375 degrees for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.

text: Combine the flour, butter, water, and salt. Be sure to melt the butter! Add all these ingredients into a big bowl and use a rubber spatula to make your crust. Core, peel, and dice the apples. Core them, then cut the skin with a butcher knife, and dice them into small, bite-size pieces. Caramelize and season the apples. Heat a pan on medium-low, and melt 2 tablespoons of butter in the pan. When the butter is melted add all the apples. Let them sit for around 5 minutes, or until they're soft enough to poke a fork through with ease. Put in the brown sugar, stir, and let them sit until the juices thicken (Around 3 minutes). Remove all heat and add the cinnamon. Cut the dough. Use any size cutter to your preference, but I usually use a cutter the size of my hands put together as a circle. Add the apples, fold, seal, and vent. Depending on the size of your pie, add apples to the middle. After they're added, fold over the dough. Seal the sides with a fork, and get a toothpick and add three, rice-size vent holes. Glaze. Combine the sugar, egg, and water in a bowl, and glaze each pie. Bake. Bake each pie at 375 degrees for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
